title: VILLAGE / LILIENNES TWINS
description: You can talk to them before and get nothing, but when you hear the twins have been to the island they tell you details about it.

dialogueTree.title: Lilienne's Twin: "The scruffy-haired little boy kicks..."
dialogueTree.english: The scruffy-haired little boy kicks a stone while the other watches him do it.
dialogueTree.polish: Rozczochrany chłopiec kopie kamień, a drugi się w tym czasie przygląda.
dialogueTree.belarusian: Кудлаты хлопчык штурхае камень, а другі ў гэты час назірае.

links.title: You: ""Real quick, boys -- where were you..."
links.english: "Real quick, boys -- where were you when you heard the voices?"
links.polish: „Szybkie pytanie, chłopcy – gdzie byliście, kiedy usłyszeliście głosy?”
links.belarusian: "Хуткае пытанне, хлопцы – дзе вы былі, калі пачулі галасы?"

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: ""There." The boy points toward one..."
links.english: "There." The boy points toward one of the ruined monoliths nearby.
links.polish: „Tam” – odpowiada chłopak, wskazując jeden ze zrujnowanych monolitów stojących w pobliżu.
links.belarusian: "Там", — адказвае хлопец, паказваючы на адзін са зруйнаваных маналітаў, што стаяць паблізу.

links.title: Lilienne's Other Twin: ""We were there." The other child no..."
links.english: "We were there." The other child nods. The Feld building looms overhead.
links.polish: „Właśnie tam byliśmy” – potwierdza drugi z braci, kiwając głową. Przed wami wznosi się budynek Felda.
links.belarusian: "Менавіта там мы былі", — пацвярджае другі з братоў, ківаючы галавой. Перад вамі ўзвышаецца будынак Фельда.

links.title: You: ""Hah! I knew it!""
links.english: "Hah! I knew it!"
links.polish: „Ha! Wiedziałem!”
links.belarusian: "Ха! Ведаў!"

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: ""Uh-huh!" one says, throwing a rock..."
links.english: "Uh-huh!" one says, throwing a rock into the sand.
links.polish: „Aha!” – stwierdza jeden z nich, rzucając kamieniem w piasek.
links.belarusian: "Ага!" — кажа адзін з іх, кідаючы камень у пясок.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Full circle." The lieutenant smile..."
links.english: "Full circle." The lieutenant smiles to himself. "Back to Feld, then. When you're ready."
links.polish: „Zatoczyliśmy koło” – porucznik uśmiecha się do siebie. „Wracamy do Felda. Jak tylko będziesz gotowy”.
links.belarusian: "Мы зрабілі круг" — лейтэнант усміхаецца сам да сябе. "Вяртаемся ў Фельда. Як толькі будзеш гатовы".

Alternate1.english: "Points back to Feld." The lieutenant frowns slightly at the building, towering ominously. "Be sure you're ready when we go in, detective."
Alternate1.polish: „Wskazuje Felda” – porucznik ze zmarszczonym lekko czołem spogląda na wznoszący się złowieszczo nad okolicą budynek. „Przygotuj się, zanim tam wejdziemy, detektywie”.
Alternate1.belarusian: "Паказвае на Фелда", — лейтэнант з лёгка нахмурыненым ілбом глядзіць на будынак, які пагрозліва ўзвышаецца над ваколіцай. "Падрыхтуйся, перш чым мы туды пойдзем, дэтэктыў".

links.title: Lilienne's Other Twin: "The boy turns the rock over in his..."
links.english: The boy turns the rock over in his hands. He looks to you, then his brother, then back to you.
links.polish: Chłopak obraca kamień trzymany w ręce. Spogląda na ciebie, na swojego brata i znowu na ciebie.
links.belarusian: Хлопец круціць камень, які трымае ў руцэ. Глядзіць на цябе, на свайго брата і зноў на цябе.

links.title: You: ""Thanks, kids.""
links.english: "Thanks, kids."
links.polish: „Dzięki, dzieciaki”.
links.belarusian: "Дзякуй, дзеткі".

links.title: You: ""And so I return to thee, Feld.""
links.english: "And so I return to thee, Feld."
links.polish: „I oto wracam do ciebie, Feld”.
links.belarusian: "І вось я вяртаюся да цябе, Фельд".

links.title: You: ""Okay kids, tell Kim here what happ..."
links.english: "Okay kids, tell Kim here what happened with the voices."
links.polish: „Dobra, dzieciaki, opowiedzcie Kimowi, co się wydarzyło z głosami”.
links.belarusian: "Добра, дзеткі, раскажыце Кіму, што здарылася з галасамі".

links.title: Lilienne's Other Twin: ""The one we heard say a bad word?"..."
links.english: "The one we heard say a bad word?" The boy shrugs. "Okay. The voices were like..." He scratches his head -- then seems to remember.
links.polish: „Te, które powiedziały brzydkie słowo?” – pyta chłopak i wzrusza ramionami. „Dobra. Te głosy mówiły jakoś tak...” – drapie się po głowie, po czym przypomina sobie.
links.belarusian: "Тыі, якія сказалі брыдкае слова?" — пытаецца хлопец і ўздымае плячыма. "Добра. Тыі галасы гаварылі неяк так..." — чухаецца па галаве, пасля чаго ўспамінае.

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: ""'It is time at last, my nasty spee..."
links.english: "'It is time at last, my nasty speedfreaks! Our brotherman is about to grow up!'"
links.polish: „»Wreszcie nadeszła ta pora, moi obleśni naspeedowani! Nasz brat za chwilę dorośnie!«”.
links.belarusian: "Нарэшце надышоў гэты час, мае агідныя насуперажаныя! Наш брат хутка вырасце!".

links.title: Lilienne's Other Twin: ""'DJ Flacio's big boy debut single..."
links.english: "'DJ Flacio's big boy debut single is here! Buckle up, because this is the fastest trash that you're ever gonna hear.'"
links.polish: „»Mamy tu debiutancki singiel całkiem dorosłego DJ-a Flacio! Zapnijcie pasy, bo to najszybszy śmieć, jaki kiedykolwiek słyszeliście«”.
links.belarusian: ""У нас тут дэбютны сінгл цалкам дарослага DJ-а Flacio! Прышпіліце рамяні, бо гэта самы хуткі смецце, якое вы калі-небудзь чулі"".

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: ""'Turn up the volume, blow those sp..."
links.english: "'Turn up the volume, blow those speakers out. Now here's---'"
links.polish: „»Podkręćcie głośność i wysadźcie w powietrze te głośniki. Oto przed wami...«”
links.belarusian: ""Падкруціце гучнасць і ўзрывайце гэтыя калонкі. Вось перад вамі..."".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I understand." The lieutenant's ey..."
links.english: "I understand." The lieutenant's eyes are wide in surprise, despite his calm voice. "Thank you. Let's have a word when you're finished, detective."
links.polish: „Rozumiem” – stwierdza porucznik spokojnym głosem, choć jego oczy są szeroko otwarte z zaskoczenia. „Dziękuję. Gdy skończysz, chciałbym zamienić z tobą słowo, detektywie”.
links.belarusian: "Разумею", — адзначае лейтэнант спакойным голасам, хоць яго вочы шырока раскрытыя ад здзіўлення. "Дзякуй. Калі скончыце, я хацеў бы перакінуцца з вамі словам, дэтэктыў".

links.title: Lilienne's Other Twin: "The boy picks up a rock. Then anoth..."
links.english: The boy picks up a rock. Then another. He looks at you and blinks.
links.polish: Chłopak podnosi kamień. A później kolejny. Spogląda na ciebie i mruga.
links.belarusian: Хлопец падымае камень. А потым яшчэ адзін. Глядзіць на цябе і міргае.

links.title: You: ""Hey, boys. Your sister told me you..."
links.english: "Hey, boys. Your sister told me you got in trouble for saying bad words."
links.polish: „Hej, chłopaki. Wasza siostra mówiła, że mieliście kłopoty przez brzydkie słowa”.
links.belarusian: "Прывітанне, хлопцы. Ваша сястра казала, што ў вас былі праблемы з-за непрыстойных слоў".

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: ""Yeah." The boy turns a rock over i..."
links.english: "Yeah." The boy turns a rock over in his hand. "We heard *bad* words and said them, and got in trouble..."
links.polish: „Taa...” – potwierdza chłopak, obracając kamień trzymany w ręce. „Usłyszeliśmy *brzydkie* słowa i powtórzyliśmy je, i wpadliśmy w tarapaty...”
links.belarusian: "Таа..." — пацвярджае хлопец, паварочваючы камень у руцэ. "Пачулі *кепскія* словы і паўтарылі іх, і апынуліся ў непрыемнасцях..."

links.title: Lilienne's Other Twin: ""Bad words," the other says, noddin..."
links.english: "Bad words," the other says, nodding absent-mindedly. "Bad, bad words..."
links.polish: „Brzydkie słowa” – powtarza drugi, kiwając w zamyśleniu głową. „Brzydkie, brzydkie słowa...”
links.belarusian: "Брыдкія словы", — паўтарае другі, ківаючы ў задуменні галавой. "Брыдкія, брыдкія словы..."

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Say *fuck.* It'd be HILARIOUS."
links.english: Say *fuck.* It'd be HILARIOUS.
links.polish: Powiedz „kurwa”. Będzie PRZEZABAWNIE.
links.belarusian: Скажы "курва". Будзе НЕВЕРАГОДНА ВЯСЁЛА.

links.title: Horrific Necktie: "It would be hilarious, my man! Live..."
links.english: It would be hilarious, my man! Live it up! Say *FUCK!*
links.polish: Byłby ubaw po pachy, chłopie! Zabawmy się! Powiedz „KURWA”!
links.belarusian: Было б веселае да ўпаду, хлопец! Давай павесялімся! Скажы "КУРВА"!

links.title: Composure: "Conduct yourself with some dignity...."
links.english: Conduct yourself with some dignity. You don't need to swear in front of the children.
links.polish: Zachowajże odrobinę godności. Nie musisz przeklinać w obecności dzieci.
links.belarusian: Захавай крышачку годнасці. Табе не трэба лаяцца ў прысутнасці дзяцей.

links.title: Logic: "Wait! Stop everything. Back this up..."
links.english: Wait! Stop everything. Back this up. What are *bad words*?
links.polish: Czekaj! Przerwij wszystko. Cofnijmy się. Co to są *brzydkie słowa*?
links.belarusian: Чакай! Прыпыні ўсё. Давайце вернемся назад. Што такое *брыдкія словы*?

links.title: Authority: "Pipe down Puzzle Face, this is a Co..."
links.english: Pipe down Puzzle Face, this is a Code Red situation! If we review all the *bad words*, that's only going to add more temptation to saying them -- in front of the *children*. And we *do not* want that.
links.polish: Uspokój się, puzzlowa buźko, mamy sytuację awaryjną! Jak teraz zaczniemy przyglądać się wszystkim *brzydkim słowom*, wzrośnie tylko pokusa, żeby je wypowiadać. *Przy dzieciach*. A tego *nie chcemy*.
links.belarusian: Супакойся, галаваломкі, у нас надзвычайная сітуацыя! Калі зараз пачнем прыглядацца да ўсіх *брыдкіх слоў*, гэта толькі павялічыць спакусу, каб іх прамаўляць. *Пры дзецях*. А гэтага *не хочам*.

links.title: You: ""Fuck.""
links.english: "Fuck."
links.polish: „Kurwa”.
links.belarusian: "Курва".

links.title: Volition: "This is a shame and a disappointmen..."
links.english: This is a shame and a disappointment.
links.polish: Wstyd i rozczarowanie.
links.belarusian: Сорам і расчараванне.

links.title: Lilienne's Other Twin: "The boy blinks. "Fffff...." Despite..."
links.english: The boy blinks. "Fffff...." Despite his efforts, the unfamiliar word catches in his mouth.
links.polish: Chłopiec mruga. „Kuuuu...” – mimo dobrych chęci, nieznane słowo więźnie w jego ustach.
links.belarusian: Хлопчык міргае. "Куууу..." – нягледзячы на добрыя намеры, невядомае слова завязла ў ягоных вуснах.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "COME ON BOYS, YOU CAN DO IT!"
links.english: COME ON BOYS, YOU CAN DO IT!
links.polish: DAWAJCIE, CHŁOPAKI! DACIE RADĘ!
links.belarusian: ДАВАЙЦЕ, ХЛОПЦЫ! ВЫ СПРАВІЦЕСЯ!

links.title: Lilienne's Other Twin: ""Ff..." The other boy tries. He loo..."
links.english: "Ff..." The other boy tries. He looks at his brother for understanding, then at you. "What does that mean?"
links.polish: „Kuu...” – próbuje drugi chłopiec. Spogląda pytająco na swojego brata, po czym na ciebie. „Co to znaczy?”
links.belarusian: "Куу..." – спрабуе другі хлопчык. Глядзіць пытальна на свайго брата, а потым на цябе. "Што гэта значыць?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Nothing. What happened? Where'd yo..."
links.english: "Nothing. What happened? Where'd you hear bad words? Was it from someone on the coast? The radio?"
links.polish: „Nic. Co się stało? Gdzie usłyszeliście brzydkie słowa? Mówił je ktoś na wybrzeżu? Może w radiu?”
links.belarusian: "Нічога. Што здарылася? Дзе вы пачулі дрэнныя словы? Хтосьці казаў іх на ўзбярэжжы? Можа быць, па радыё?"

links.title: Empathy: "The lieutenant is deeply unimpresse..."
links.english: The lieutenant is deeply unimpressed.
links.polish: Porucznik jest głęboko oburzony.
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант глыбока абураны.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Why does he have to be such a binoc..."
links.english: Why does he have to be such a binoclard? It's just a funny word!
links.polish: Czemu on musi być takim cholernym pinglarzem? To tylko śmieszne słowo!
links.belarusian: Чаму ён павінен быць такім хвалёным пінгларом? Гэта ўсяго толькі смешнае слова!

links.title: Empathy: "The boys seem less happy now."
links.english: The boys seem less happy now.
links.polish: Chłopcy wydają się teraz mniej zadowoleni.
links.belarusian: Хлопцы здаюцца цяпер менш задаволенымі.

links.title: Lilienne's Other Twin: ""We didn't hear that word. We heard..."
links.english: "We didn't hear that word. We heard other bad words..."
links.polish: „Nie słyszeliśmy tego słowa. Słyszeliśmy inne brzydkie słowa...”
links.belarusian: "Мы не чулі гэтага слова. Мы чулі іншыя непрыгожыя словы..."

links.title: You: ""It's a bad word. The worst word.""
links.english: "It's a bad word. The worst word."
links.polish: „To brzydkie słowo. Najbrzydsze z możliwych”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта брыдкае слова. Найбрыдчэйшае з магчымых".

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: ""Oh..." The boy looks uncomfortable..."
links.english: "Oh..." The boy looks uncomfortable, at the jetty toward his mother.
links.polish: „Och...” – chłopak spogląda niespokojnie na pirs i znajdującą się na nim matkę.
links.belarusian: "Ох..." — хлопец неспакойна паглядае на пірс і на маці, якая знаходзіцца на ім.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Preach it, brother! Spread the good..."
links.english: Preach it, brother! Spread the good word *fuck* all over town!
links.polish: Głoś tę dobrą nowinę, bracie! Niech całe miasto usłyszy słowo *kurwa*!
links.belarusian: Галосі гэтую добрую навіну, братка! Няхай усё горад пачуе слова *курва*!

links.title: You: ""It's a mystery. You'll have to fin..."
links.english: "It's a mystery. You'll have to find out yourselves."
links.polish: „To tajemnica. Będziecie musieli odkryć ją sami”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта таямніца. Вы мусіце адкрыць яе самі".

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: ""Oh..." The boy looks uncomfortable..."
links.english: "Oh..." The boy looks uncomfortable, at the jetty toward his mother.
links.polish: „Och...” – chłopak spogląda niespokojnie na pirs i znajdującą się na nim matkę.
links.belarusian: "Ох..." — хлопец неспакойна глядзіць на пірс і на маці, якая знаходзіцца на ім.

links.title: Lilienne's Other Twin: ""We didn't hear that word. We heard..."
links.english: "We didn't hear that word. We heard other bad words..."
links.polish: „Nie słyszeliśmy tego słowa. Słyszeliśmy inne brzydkie słowa...”
links.belarusian: "Мы не чулі гэтага слова. Мы чулі іншыя брыдкія словы..."

links.title: You: ""Bad words? What bourgeois mentalit..."
links.english: "Bad words? What bourgeois mentality, to deem certain *working class words* bad."
links.polish: „Brzydkie słowa? Co za burżuazyjna mentalność, określać niektóre *słowa klasy robotniczej* mianem brzydkich”.
links.belarusian: "Брыдкія словы? Якая буржуазная ментальнасць, назваць некаторыя *словы працоўнага класа* брыдкімі".

links.title: Lilienne's Other Twin: ""Bou... what?" The boy gently tosse..."
links.english: "Bou... what?" The boy gently tosses his rock at the rock tower, and misses. "Was that a bad word?"
links.polish: „Bur... co?” – pyta chłopak, po czym rzuca delikatnie swój kamień w kierunku kamiennej wieży i pudłuje. „Czy to brzydkie słowo?”
links.belarusian: "Бур... што?" — пытаецца хлопец, пасля чаго лёгка кідае свой камень у бок каменнай вежы і прамахваецца. "Ці гэта брыдкае слова?"

links.title: You: ""Bourgeois? Yes. One of the worst,..."
links.english: "Bourgeois? Yes. One of the worst, child."
links.polish: „Burżuazja? Tak. Jedno z najgorszych, mały”.
links.belarusian: "Буржуазія? Так. Адно з найгоршых, малы".

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: ""Don't say more bad words!" The boy..."
links.english: "Don't say more bad words!" The boy frowns.
links.polish: „Niech pan już nie mówi więcej brzydkich słów!” – woła chłopak, marszcząc czoło.
links.belarusian: "Не кажыце больш дрэнных слоў!" — крычыць хлопец, моршчачы лоб.

links.title: You: ""Nah. I just thought it was funny t..."
links.english: "Nah. I just thought it was funny to say."
links.polish: „Nie. Po prostu pomyślałem, że śmiesznie je będzie powiedzieć”.
links.belarusian: "Не. Проста падумаў, што гэта будзе смешна сказаць".

links.title: Lilienne's Other Twin: "don't know why it's funny..." The b..."
links.english: don't know why it's funny..." The boy frowns.
links.polish: „Nie wiem, co w tym śmiesznego...” – stwierdza chłopak, marszcząc czoło.
links.belarusian: "Я не ведаю, што ў гэтым смешнага..." – адзначае хлопец, зморшчыўшы лоб.

links.title: You: ""Bad words are bad. Don't say them,..."
links.english: "Bad words are bad. Don't say them, kids. It's a first step to a life of crime."
links.polish: „Brzydkie słowa są brzydkie. Nie mówcie ich, dzieciaki. To pierwszy krok do zostania przestępcą”.
links.belarusian: "Брыдкія словы — брыдкія. Не кажыце іх, дзеці. Гэта першы крок да таго, каб стаць злачынцам".

links.title: Lilienne's Other Twin: ""We won't," the little boy says. He..."
links.english: "We won't," the little boy says. He adjusts his cap in the cool air.
links.polish: „Nie będziemy” – zapewnia chłopczyk, po czym poprawia swoją czapkę.
links.belarusian: "Мы не будзем", — запэўнівае хлопчык, пасля чаго папраўляе сваю шапку.

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: ""We learned," the other replies."
links.english: "We learned," the other replies.
links.polish: „Dostaliśmy nauczkę” – odpowiada drugi.
links.belarusian: "Мы атрымалі ўрок" — адказвае другі.

links.title: Volition: "Good on you. I know you were tempte..."
links.english: Good on you. I know you were tempted to shout *fuck*, but you controlled your impulse. Well done.
links.polish: Dobra robota. Wiem, że kusiło cię, żeby krzyknąć „kurwa”, ale opanowałeś ten impuls. Dobra robota.
links.belarusian: Добрая праца. Ведаю, што цябе спакушала крыкнуць "к...а", але ты стрымаўся. Добрая праца.

links.title: You: ""Let's move on. Where did you hear..."
links.english: "Let's move on. Where did you hear the bad words -- was it from someone on the coast? The radio?"
links.polish: „Przejdźmy dalej. Gdzie usłyszeliście te brzydkie słowa? Od kogoś na wybrzeżu? W radiu?”
links.belarusian: "Пойдзем далей. Дзе вы пачулі гэтыя непрыгожыя словы? Ад кагосьці на ўзбярэжжы? Па радыё?"

links.title: You: ""Okay. What happened?""
links.english: "Okay. What happened?"
links.polish: „No dobrze. Co się stało?”
links.belarusian: "Ну добра. Што здарылася?"

links.title: Lilienne's Other Twin: ""We just heard funny voices." The b..."
links.english: "We just heard funny voices." The boy shrugs. His jacket whispers as his shoulders move.
links.polish: „Usłyszeliśmy śmieszne głosy” – stwierdza chłopak, wzruszając ramionami. Nagłemu ruchowi towarzyszy szelest jego kurtki.
links.belarusian: "Мы чулі смешныя галасы", — кажа хлопец, паціскаючы плячыма. Раптоўны рух суправаджае шолах ягонай курткі.

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: ""We thought the voices were funny."..."
links.english: "We thought the voices were funny." The brother nods. "We said what they said and then we got in trouble..."
links.polish: „Myśleliśmy, że głosy były śmieszne” – potwierdza jego brat. „Powtórzyliśmy, co mówiły, i przez to mieliśmy kłopoty...”
links.belarusian: "Мы думалі, што галасы былі смешныя", — пацвярджае яго брат. "Мы паўтарылі, што яны казалі, і з-за гэтага трапілі ў непрыемнасці..."

links.title: You: ""Where did you hear them? Did you o..."
links.english: "Where did you hear them? Did you overhear someone say them? Was it on the radio?"
links.polish: „Gdzie je usłyszeliście? Podsłuchaliście, jak ktoś je mówił? A może usłyszeliście radio?”
links.belarusian: "Дзе вы іх пачулі? Падслухалі, як нехта іх казаў? А можа, пачулі радыё?"

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: ""Radio? What's that?" The boy sniff..."
links.english: "Radio? What's that?" The boy sniffs up a drip of snot. "We just heard them. In our head."
links.polish: „Radio? Co to jest?” – pyta chłopak, pociągając nosem. „Po prostu słyszeliśmy je. W głowach”.
links.belarusian: "Радыё? Што гэта?" — пытае хлопец, пацягваючы носам. "Проста мы чулі яго. У галовах".

links.title: Conceptualization: "Could it be? Do their minds work in..."
links.english: Could it be? Do their minds work in the same way?
links.polish: Czy to możliwe? Czy ich umysły działają identycznie?
links.belarusian: Ці магчыма гэта? Ці іх розумы працуюць аднолькава?

links.title: Inland Empire: "Voices from another self? Voices fr..."
links.english: Voices from another self? Voices from *a deeper self*?  Voices from... *early schizophrenia*?
links.polish: Głosy z innego ja? Z *głębszego* ja? Głosy... *wczesnej schizofrenii*?
links.belarusian: Голасы з іншага сябе? З *глыбокага* сябе? Голасы... *ранняй шызафрэніі*?

links.title: You: ""Voices in your head? Like little b..."
links.english: "Voices in your head? Like little bleeps and bloops of information?"
links.polish: „Głosy w waszych głowach? Takie jakby małe strzępki informacji?”
links.belarusian: "Галасы ў вашых галовах? Такія як быццам маленькія ўрыўкі інфармацыі?"

links.title: Lilienne's Other Twin: ""No." The boy shakes his head. "Jus..."
links.english: "No." The boy shakes his head. "Just people talking real fast."
links.polish: „Nie” – chłopak kręci głową. „Tylko ludzie mówiący bardzo szybko”.
links.belarusian: "Не" — хлопец пакручвае галавой. "Толькі людзі, якія гавораць вельмі хутка".

links.title: You: ""Okay. What did you hear?""
links.english: "Okay. What did you hear?"
links.polish: „No dobrze. I co usłyszeliście?”
links.belarusian: "Ну добра. І што вы пачулі?"

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: ""Uh..." He scratches his head. He l..."
links.english: "Uh..." He scratches his head. He looks at his twin, who nods -- and then he begins. "It was like... 'It is time at last, my nasty speedfreaks! Our brotherman is about to grow up!'"
links.polish: „Ee...” – drapie się po głowie. Patrzy na swojego bliźniaka, który kiwa głową, po czym zaczyna mówić. „To było coś takiego: »Wreszcie nadeszła ta pora, moi obleśni naspeedowani! Nasz brat za chwilę dorośnie!«”.
links.belarusian: "Эээ..." — пачухаў ён галаву. Глядзіць на свайго двайніка, які ківае галавой, пасля чаго пачынае гаварыць. "Гэта было нешта такое: "Нарэшце надышоў гэты час, мае брыдкія, наафлімаваныя! Наш брат зараз стане дарослым!"".

links.title: Reaction Speed: "A memory stirs. You've heard this q..."
links.english: A memory stirs. You've heard this quickfire patter before.
links.polish: Nagłe wspomnienie. Słyszałeś już taką mowę niczym seria z karabinu.
links.belarusian: Раптоўнае ўспамінанне. Чуў ужо такую гаворку, нібы серыя з аўтамата.

links.title: Lilienne's Other Twin: ""'DJ Flacio's big boy debut single..."
links.english: "'DJ Flacio's big boy debut single is here! Buckle up, because this is the fastest trash that you're ever gonna hear.'"
links.polish: „»Mamy tu debiutancki singiel całkiem dorosłego DJ-a Flacio! Zapnijcie pasy, bo to najszybszy śmieć, jaki kiedykolwiek słyszeliście«”.
links.belarusian: ""У нас тут дэбютны сінгл цалкам дарослага DJ-я Flacio! Прышпіліце рамяні, бо гэта найхутчэйшы смецце, якое вы калі-небудзь чулі"".

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: ""'Turn up the volume, blow those sp..."
links.english: "'Turn up the volume, blow those speakers out. Now here's---'"
links.polish: „»Podkręćcie głośność i wysadźcie w powietrze te głośniki. Oto przed wami...«”
links.belarusian: "Падкруціце гучнасць і ўзарвіце гэтыя дынамікі. Вось перад вамі..."

links.title: Lilienne's Other Twin: ""No!" The brother cuts in, suddenly..."
links.english: "No!" The brother cuts in, suddenly and sharply. "Don't say bad words, stupid!"
links.polish: „Nie!” – wtrąca się nagle jego brat. „Nie mów brzydkich słów, głupi!”
links.belarusian: "Не!" — раптам умешваецца яго брат. "Не кажы непрыстойных слоў, дурны!"

links.title: Drama: "Why, what a splendid rendition thes..."
links.english: Why, what a splendid rendition these two rapsssssssssscallions have offered us here today! Faultless memorization! Perchance they'll enjoy greatness as a double-act in the Performing Artsss.
links.polish: Och, cóż jakże wspaniale te urwisssssssssy odegrały dziś przed nami tę rolę! Niezrównana pamięć! Może kiedyś oczarują świat jako dwuossssobowa grupa teatralna.
links.belarusian: Ох, як жа цудоўна гэтыя гарэзы сёння перад намі выканалі гэту ролю! Неперасягненая памяць! Можа, калі-небудзь зачаруюць свет як двухасабовая тэатральная група.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""A word when you're done." The lieu..."
links.english: "A word when you're done." The lieutenant clears his throat. His eyes are wider than usual.
links.polish: „Po wszystkim chcę zamienić z tobą słowo” – porucznik odchrząkuje. Jego oczy są otwarte szerzej niż zwykle.
links.belarusian: "Пасля ўсяго я хачу перакінуцца з табой словам", — прапаршчык адкашляўся. Яго вочы шырэй адкрыты, чым звычайна.

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: "The boy draws a jagged rock across..."
links.english: The boy draws a jagged rock across the ground. It leaves a white scratch.
links.polish: Chłopak przeciąga kanciastym kamieniem po ziemi. Pojawia się biała rysa.
links.belarusian: Хлопец цягне вуглаваты камень па зямлі. З'яўляецца белая драпіна.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Elsewhere in Revachol, the Lieutena..."
links.english: Elsewhere in Revachol, the Lieutenant switches on the radio. His head rocks subtly to a violent track. He needs to hear this story.
links.polish: Gdzieś w Revacholu porucznik włącza radio. Kiwa delikatnie głową do agresywnej muzyki. Powinien usłyszeć tę historię.
links.belarusian: Недзе ў Рэвашолі лейтэнант уключае радыё. Лёгка ківае галавой у такт агрэсіўнай музыкі. Ён павінен пачуць гэтую гісторыю.

links.title: You: ""Any family history of schizophreni..."
links.english: "Any family history of schizophrenia?"
links.polish: „Macie w rodzinie przypadki schizofrenii?”
links.belarusian: "У вас у сям'і ёсць выпадкі шызафрэніі?"

links.title: Lilienne's Other Twin: ""Is that a bad word?" The boy blink..."
links.english: "Is that a bad word?" The boy blinks at you.
links.polish: „Czy to brzydkie słowo?” – pyta chłopiec, mrugając.
links.belarusian: "Гэта брыдкае слова?" – пытаецца хлопчык, міргаючы.

links.title: You: ""No. Just tell me what you heard.""
links.english: "No. Just tell me what you heard."
links.polish: „Nie. Powiedzcie po prostu, co usłyszeliście”.
links.belarusian: "Не. Проста скажыце, што пачулі".

links.title: You: ""Sure. But what words did you hear?""
links.english: "Sure. But what words did you hear?"
links.polish: „Jasne. Ale jakie słowa usłyszeliście?”
links.belarusian: "Вядома. Але якія словы вы пачулі?"

links.title: You: ""'Fuck' is the bad word, remember?..."
links.english: "'Fuck' is the bad word, remember? But tell me what you heard."
links.polish: „»Kurwa« to złe słowo, pamiętacie? Ale powiedzcie, co usłyszeliście”.
links.belarusian: "Курва" — гэта дрэннае слова, памятаеце? Але скажыце, што вы пачулі.

links.title: You: ""What do you mean you 'heard them i..."
links.english: "What do you mean you 'heard them in your head'?"
links.polish: „Jak to słyszeliście je w głowach?”
links.belarusian: "Як гэта вы чулі ў галовах?"

links.title: Lilienne's Other Twin: ""You know." He points at his head...."
links.english: "You know." He points at his head. His fingers are red from the cold. "I heard people talking. Except just in my head!"
links.polish: „No wie pan” – wskazuje swoją głowę. Jego palce są czerwone z zimna. „Słyszałem jak ludzie mówią. Tylko w mojej głowie!”
links.belarusian: "Ну вось, пане", — паказвае на сваю галаву. Яго пальцы чырвоныя ад холаду. "Чуў, як людзі гавораць. Толькі ў маёй галаве!"

links.title: You: ""Kids, has anything *strange* happe..."
links.english: "Kids, has anything *strange* happened lately?"
links.polish: „Dzieciaki, działo się tu ostatnio coś *dziwnego*?”
links.belarusian: "Дзеці, адбывалася тут апошнім часам нешта *дзіўнае*?"

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: ""Uhm..." The boy turns a rock over..."
links.english: "Uhm..." The boy turns a rock over in his hand. "We heard *bad* words and said them, and got in trouble..."
links.polish: „Ee...” – chłopak obraca kamień trzymany w ręce. „Usłyszeliśmy *brzydkie* słowa i powtórzyliśmy je, i wpadliśmy w tarapaty...”
links.belarusian: "Ээ..." — хлопец крутзіць камень, які трымае ў руцэ. "Мы пачулі *нядобрыя* словы і пераказалі іх, і гэта прывяло да непрыемнасцей..."

links.title: You: ""Okay kids. You've been to that isl..."
links.english: "Okay kids. You've been to that island, right?"
links.polish: „No dobra, chłopcy. Byliście na tej wyspie, nie?”
links.belarusian: "Ну добра, хлопцы. Вы ж былі на гэтым востраве, так?"

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: ""On that island?" The one who's bus..."
links.english: "On that island?" The one who's busy kicking his stone points to the bay.
links.polish: „Na tej wyspie?” – pyta chłopak zajęty kopaniem kamienia, wskazując na zatokę.
links.belarusian: "На гэтым востраве?" — пытаецца хлопец, заняты капаннем каменя, паказваючы на затоку.

links.title: You: ""Yes, that one. I need to know what..."
links.english: "Yes, that one. I need to know what's there."
links.polish: „Tak, na tej. Muszę się dowiedzieć, co tam jest”.
links.belarusian: "Так, на той. Мне трэба даведацца, што там ёсць".

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: ""That's... uhm... nothing?" The boy..."
links.english: "That's... uhm... nothing?" The boy pauses to think with his finger in his mouth. "It's just a seafort and some plants. You can take a raft there. It's great."
links.polish: „Tam... ee... nie ma nic?” – chłopak zamyśla się przez chwilę z palcem w ustach. „To tylko fort morski i trochę roślin. Można tam popłynąć tratwą. Jest fajnie”.
links.belarusian: "Там... ээ... няма нічога?" – хлопец задумваецца на хвіліну з пальцам у роце. "Гэта толькі марскі форт і трохі раслін. Можна туды паплыць на плыце. Гэта класна".

links.title: Lilienne's Other Twin: ""And! And!" the other one butts in...."
links.english: "And! And!" the other one butts in. "We make a fire. We make a... we make a fire."
links.polish: „I! I!” – wtrąca się drugi. „Rozpalamy ogień. Rozpalamy... Rozpalamy ognisko”.
links.belarusian: "Я! Я!" — умешваецца другі. "Разводзім агонь. Разводзім... Разводзім вогнішча".

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: ""Mhm," his brother nods. "Gather th..."
links.english: "Mhm," his brother nods. "Gather the sticks for the fire -- and bullets. Or not real bullets, empty bullets."
links.polish: „Mhm” – kiwa głową drugi brat. „Zbieramy patyki na ognisko – i naboje. Ale nie prawdziwe naboje – puste naboje”.
links.belarusian: "Мгм" – ківае галавой другі брат. "Збіраем палачкі на вогнішча – і патроны. Але не сапраўдныя патроны – пустыя патроны".

links.title: Logic: "Bullet shells? There are a lot of t..."
links.english: Bullet shells? There are a lot of them left over from the war -- but this could be important.
links.polish: Łuski po nabojach? Dużo ich zostało po wojnie, ale to może być istotne.
links.belarusian: Гільзы ад патронаў? Шмат іх засталося пасля вайны, але гэта можа быць істотна.

links.title: You: ""Wait, you mean *shells*?""
links.english: "Wait, you mean *shells*?"
links.polish: „Zaraz, masz na myśli *łuski*?”
links.belarusian: "Пачакай, ты маеш на ўвазе *лушчы*?"

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: ""I don't know what those are...""
links.english: "I don't know what those are..."
links.polish: „Nie wiem, co to takiego...”
links.belarusian: "Не ведаю, што гэта такое..."

links.title: You: ""What then?""
links.english: "What then?"
links.polish: „I co jeszcze?”
links.belarusian: "А што яшчэ?"

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: ""There are lights. The fire guy com..."
links.english: "There are lights. The fire guy comes and asks us to put the fire out."
links.polish: „Pojawiają się światła. Przychodzi ogniowy facet i każe nam zgasić ogień”.
links.belarusian: "З'яўляюцца агні. Прыходзіць чалавек з агню і загадвае нам пагасіць агонь".

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Your nerve endings *sting* from the..."
links.english: Your nerve endings *sting* from the mention of a *guy*.
links.polish: Czujesz, jak *kłują* cię końcówki nerwów na wspomnienie o *facecie*.
links.belarusian: Адчуваеш, як *колюць* цябе канцы нерваў пры ўспаміне пра *хлопца*.

links.title: Rhetoric: "They must mean a human being. On th..."
links.english: They must mean a human being. On that island? But it's cut off...
links.polish: Muszą mówić o jakimś człowieku. Na tej wyspie? Ale ona jest odcięta od świata...
links.belarusian: Яны павінны гаварыць пра нейкага чалавека. На гэтым востраве? Але ён адрэзаны ад свету...

links.title: You: ""Someone lives on the island?""
links.english: "Someone lives on the island?"
links.polish: „Ktoś na tej wyspie mieszka?”
links.belarusian: "Хтосьці на гэтым востраве жыве?"

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: ""No," the boy answers, shaking his..."
links.english: "No," the boy answers, shaking his head vehemently.
links.polish: „Nie” – odpowiada chłopiec, kręcąc zdecydowanie głową.
links.belarusian: "Не" — адказвае хлопчык, рашуча круцячы галавой.

links.title: Lilienne's Other Twin: ""Yes." His brother looks at him, th..."
links.english: "Yes." His brother looks at him, then at you.
links.polish: „Tak” – jego brat spogląda na niego, a później na ciebie.
links.belarusian: "Так" — яго брат паглядзеў на яго, а потым на цябе.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Let's go with *yes*." The lieutena..."
links.english: "Let's go with *yes*." The lieutenant raises his eyebrows and whips out his notebook.
links.polish: „Przyjmijmy, że odpowiedź brzmi *tak*” – porucznik unosi lekko brew i wyjmuje swój notatnik.
links.belarusian: "Прынямем, што адказ *так*", — лейтэнант злёгку падымае брыво і дастае свой нататнік.

links.title: You: ""Why is he the *fire* guy?""
links.english: "Why is he the *fire* guy?"
links.polish: „Czemu to *ogniowy* facet?”
links.belarusian: "Чаму гэта *агністы* чалавек?"

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: ""Because.... because..." The boy pa..."
links.english: "Because.... because..." The boy pauses to think.
links.polish: „Bo... bo...” – chłopiec milknie, aby pomyśleć.
links.belarusian: "Бо... бо..." — хлопчык сціхае, каб падумаць.

links.title: Lilienne's Other Twin: ""Because he asks to put the fire ou..."
links.english: "Because he asks to put the fire out!" the other explains.
links.polish: „Bo każe nam gasić ogień!” – wyjaśnia drugi.
links.belarusian: "Бо загадвае нам гасіць агонь!" – тлумачыць другі.

links.title: You: ""Why does he ask you to put the fir..."
links.english: "Why does he ask you to put the fire out?"
links.polish: „Czemu każe wam gasić ogień?”
links.belarusian: "Чаму загадвае вам гасіць агонь?"

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: ""Uhm... I don't know. He doesn't li..."
links.english: "Uhm... I don't know. He doesn't like it. He doesn't like people to be there. You shouldn't go."
links.polish: „Ee... Nie wiem. Nie lubi go. Nie lubi, jak są tam ludzie. Nie powinien pan tam płynąć”.
links.belarusian: "Ээ... Не ведаю. Не любіць яго. Не любіць, калі там ёсць людзі. Вам не варта туды плылі".

links.title: Lilienne's Other Twin: ""Yes," the other one adds laconical..."
links.english: "Yes," the other one adds laconically, standing with his hands glued to his sides like a little tin soldier.
links.polish: „Tak” – dodaje drugi lakonicznie, stojąc na baczność jak mały ołowiany żołnierzyk.
links.belarusian: "Так" — дадае другі лаканічна, стоячы навыцяжку, як маленькі алавяны салдацік.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Because he doesn't want to be found..."
links.english: Because he doesn't want to be found. Smoke traces...
links.polish: Bo nie chce być znaleziony. Dym zwraca uwagę...
links.belarusian: Бо не хоча быць знойдзены. Дым прыцягвае ўвагу...

links.title: Half Light: "A suspicious request. Made out of f..."
links.english: A suspicious request. Made out of fear?
links.polish: Podejrzane żądanie. Zrodzone ze strachu?
links.belarusian: Падазронае патрабаванне. Народжанае са страху?

links.title: You: ""You mentioned something about *lig..."
links.english: "You mentioned something about *lights*?"
links.polish: „Wspomnieliście coś o *światłach*?”
links.belarusian: "Вы згадалі штосьці пра *святло*?"

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: ""I..." starts one of them -- it's h..."
links.english: "I..." starts one of them -- it's hard to tell which one now. "I don't know."
links.polish: „Ja...” – zaczyna jeden z nich – trudno powiedzieć który. „Ja nie wiem”.
links.belarusian: "Я..." – пачынае адзін з іх – цяжка сказаць хто. "Я не ведаю".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Did you mean there are *electrical..."
links.english: "Did you mean there are *electrical* lights?" He points to the streetlight.
links.polish: „Mieliście na myśli *elektryczne* światła?” – pyta, wskazując uliczną latarnię.
links.belarusian: "Вы мелі на ўвазе *электрычныя* лямпы?" — пытаецца ён, паказваючы на вулічны ліхтар.

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: ""Uhm... yes." The boy looks at his..."
links.english: "Uhm... yes." The boy looks at his toes.
links.polish: „Ee... tak” – odpowiada chłopak i wpatruje się w palce swoich stóp.
links.belarusian: "Ээ... так," — адказвае хлопец і ўзіраецца ў пальцы сваіх ног.

links.title: You: ""Is there anything else you can tel..."
links.english: "Is there anything else you can tell me about this *guy*? Age? Does he live there?"
links.polish: „Możecie powiedzieć mi cokolwiek więcej o tym *facecie*? Ile ma lat? Mieszka tam?”
links.belarusian: "Ці можаце вы сказаць мне што-небудзь больш пра гэтага *хлопца*? Колькі яму гадоў? Ён там жыве?"

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: ""No, he doesn't live there. I don't..."
links.english: "No, he doesn't live there. I don't think."
links.polish: „Nie, on tam nie mieszka. Tak myślę”.
links.belarusian: "Не, ён там не жыве. Так думаю".

links.title: Lilienne's Other Twin: ""No, he lives there." The other nod..."
links.english: "No, he lives there." The other nods. "He's been there twice, two times."
links.polish: „Nie, on tam mieszka” – kiwa głową drugi chłopak. „Był tam dwukrotnie, dwa razy”.
links.belarusian: "Не, ён там жыве", — ківае галавой другі хлопец. "Быў там двойчы, два разы".

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: ""Huh..." The first one pauses to th..."
links.english: "Huh..." The first one pauses to think, then comes to some kind of conclusion. "He doesn't live there. He isn't there sometimes."
links.polish: „Hmm...” – pierwszy zamyśla się, po czym dochodzi do jakiejś konkluzji. „On tam nie mieszka. Czasem go tam nie ma”.
links.belarusian: "Гм…" – першы задумваецца, а потым прыходзіць да нейкай высновы. "Ён там не жыве. Часам яго там няма".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Anything else? What does this guy..."
links.english: "Anything else? What does this guy look like?"
links.polish: „Jeszcze coś? Jak on wygląda?”
links.belarusian: "Яшчэ нешта? Як ён выглядае?"

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: ""I don't know," they say almost in..."
links.english: "I don't know," they say almost in unison.
links.polish: „Nie wiem” – odpowiadają niemal jednocześnie.
links.belarusian: "Не ведаю" — адказваюць амаль адначасова.

links.title: You: ""How come?""
links.english: "How come?"
links.polish: „Jak to?”
links.belarusian: "Як гэта?"

links.title: Lilienne's Other Twin: ""We... we ran. He just yelled we sh..."
links.english: "We... we ran. He just yelled we shouldn't be there."
links.polish: „My... My uciekliśmy. Krzyczał, że nie powinniśmy tam być”.
links.belarusian: "Мы... Мы ўцяклі. Ён крычаў, што мы не павінны там быць".

links.title: You: ""Anything else? What does this guy..."
links.english: "Anything else? What does this guy look like?"
links.polish: „Jeszcze coś? Jak on wygląda?”
links.belarusian: "Яшчэ нешта? Як ён выглядае?"

links.title: You: ""Your father used to go to that isl..."
links.english: "Your father used to go to that island too, didn't he?"
links.polish: „Wasz ojciec też pływał na tę wyspę, prawda?”
links.belarusian: "Ваш бацька таксама плаваў на гэты востраў, праўда?"

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: ""Our father killed himself.""
links.english: "Our father killed himself."
links.polish: „Nasz ojciec się zabił”.
links.belarusian: "Наш бацька забіў сябе".

links.title: Lilienne's Other Twin: ""Don't say that. He didn't." His br..."
links.english: "Don't say that. He didn't." His brother punches him. The boy's eyes well up like he's about to start crying.
links.polish: „Nie mów tak. To nieprawda” – stwierdza jego brat i daje mu kuksańca. W jego oczach pojawiają się łzy, jakby za chwilę miał się rozpłakać.
links.belarusian: "Не кажы так. Гэта няпраўда", — гаворыць ягоны брат і штурхае яго. У яго вачах з'яўляюцца слёзы, быццам ён вось-вось заплача.

links.title: Pain Threshold: "A dull pain flashes through your mi..."
links.english: A dull pain flashes through your mind.
links.polish: W głowie rozbłyskuje ci tępy ból.
links.belarusian: У галаве ўспыхвае тупы боль.

links.title: You: ""It's okay to kill yourself, you kn..."
links.english: "It's okay to kill yourself, you know. I'm gonna blow my brains out. Gonna close this one final case and then *blam* -- I'm outta here."
links.polish: „Wiecie, to nic złego się zabić. Ja na przykład odstrzelę sobie łeb. Zamknę to ostatnie śledztwo, a potem *bam*. Żegnam się ze światem”.
links.belarusian: "Ведаеце, няма нічога дрэннага ў тым, каб забіць сябе. Я, напрыклад, адстрэлю сабе башку. Закрыю гэта апошняе расследаванне, а потым *бам*. Развітаюся з жыццём".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Shut up." The lieutenant jabs you..."
links.english: "Shut up." The lieutenant jabs you in the ribs with his elbow, then turns to the boy...
links.polish: „Zamknij się” – syczy porucznik i wbija ci łokieć w żebra, po czym zwraca się do chłopaka...
links.belarusian: "Зачыніся" — шыпіць лейтэнант і ўпірае табе локцем у рэбры, пасля чаго звяртаецца да хлопца...

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Don't punch your brother.... pleas..."
links.english: "Don't punch your brother.... please. Don't start crying. We still need to ask more questions."
links.polish: „Nie bij swojego brata... proszę. I nie płacz. Musimy zadać wam jeszcze kilka pytań”.
links.belarusian: "Не бі свайго брата... калі ласка. І не плач. Мы павінны задаць вам яшчэ некалькі пытанняў".

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: ""I'm not gonna start *crying*," the..."
links.english: "I'm not gonna start *crying*," the one who almost started crying snaps, regaining control of his quivering chin.
links.polish: „Wcale nie będę *płakał*” – odpiera ten, który niemal się popłakał, i odzyskuje kontrolę nad swoją drżącą brodą.
links.belarusian: "Зусім не буду *плакаць*", — адказвае той, хто амаль расплакаўся, і аднаўляе кантроль над сваёй дрыготкай барадой.

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: ""Please don't..." The boy's eyes we..."
links.english: "Please don't..." The boy's eyes well up as he looks at you. They're dark and round. The wind tussles his hair.
links.polish: „Proszę, nie...” – oczy chłopaka wypełniają się łzami, gdy na ciebie patrzy. Są ciemne i okrągłe. Wiatr mierzwi jego włosy.
links.belarusian: "Калі ласка, не..." — вочы хлопца напаўняюцца слязьмі, калі ён глядзіць на цябе. Яны цёмныя і круглыя. Вецер калечыць яго валасы.

Alternate1.english: The boy's eyes well up as he looks at you. They're dark and round. The wind tussles his hair.
Alternate1.polish: Oczy chłopaka wypełniają się łzami, gdy na ciebie patrzy. Są ciemne i okrągłe. Wiatr mierzwi jego włosy.
Alternate1.belarusian: Вочы хлопца напаўняюцца слязьмі, калі ён глядзіць на цябе. Яны цёмныя і круглыя. Вецер трасе яго валасы.

links.title: Lilienne's Other Twin: ""Don't start *crying*," his brother..."
links.english: "Don't start *crying*," his brother says, then, in a whisper, adds: "I'm sorry."
links.polish: „Nie *becz*” – prosi go brat, po czym dodaje szeptem: „Przepraszam”.
links.belarusian: "Не *плач*" — просіць яго брат, пасля чаго дадае шэптам: "Прабач".

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: "The other boy straightens his back...."
links.english: The other boy straightens his back. "I'm not gonna start *crying*, stupid," he snaps, regaining control of his quivering chin.
links.polish: Drugi chłopiec prostuje się. „Wcale nie będę *beczał*, głupi” – odpiera, odzyskując kontrolę nad swoją drżącą brodą.
links.belarusian: Другі хлопец выпростваецца. "Увогуле не буду *слязіцца*, дурны" — адказвае, аднаўляючы кантроль над сваім дрыжачым падбародкам.

links.title: You: ""Your father did not kill himself.""
links.english: "Your father did not kill himself."
links.polish: „Wasz ojciec się nie zabił”.
links.belarusian: "Ваш бацька не забіў сябе".

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: ""I don't know..." The boy who made..."
links.english: "I don't know..." The boy who made the claim finds himself unsure of it. He looks around.
links.polish: „No nie wiem...” – stwierdza niepewnie chłopak, który wcześniej twierdził inaczej. Rozgląda się.
links.belarusian: "Ну, я не ведаю..." — няўпэўнена заяўляе хлопец, які раней сцвярджаў інакш. Азіраецца.

links.title: Lilienne's Other Twin: "The other watches him, brows knitte..."
links.english: The other watches him, brows knitted. "It doesn't even have anything to do with this, you. Father isn't the fire guy."
links.polish: Drugi przygląda się mu ze zmarszczonym czołem. „To nie ma nic do rzeczy. Ojciec nie jest ogniowym facetem”.
links.belarusian: Другі глядзіць на яго з нахмураным ілбом. "Гэта не мае ніякага значэння. Бацька не пажарны чалавек".

links.title: Logic: "The two things are *unconnected*. Y..."
links.english: The two things are *unconnected*. Your question didn't make sense.
links.polish: Te dwie sprawy są *niepowiązane*. Twoje pytanie nie miało sensu.
links.belarusian: Гэтыя дзве справы *не звязаныя*. Тваё пытанне не мела сэнсу.

links.title: You: ""He killed himself all right.""
links.english: "He killed himself all right."
links.polish: „Właśnie tak. Zabił się”.
links.belarusian: "Вось так. Ён забіў сябе".

links.title: You: "Say nothing."
links.english: Say nothing.
links.polish: Nic nie mów.
links.belarusian: Нічога не кажы.

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: ""I'm sorry." The one says to the ot..."
links.english: "I'm sorry." The one says to the other, rubbing his brother's shoulder affectionately.
links.polish: „Przepraszam” – odpowiada drugi chłopak, poklepując czule ramię swojego brata.
links.belarusian: "Прабач", — адказвае другі хлопец, пяшчотна пагладжваючы плячо свайго брата.

links.title: You: ""Is that all you know? Is there any..."
links.english: "Is that all you know? Is there anything more you can tell me about the island?" (Conclude.)
links.polish: „To wszystko, co wiecie? Jesteście w stanie powiedzieć mi jeszcze coś o wyspie?” (Zakończ).
links.belarusian: "Гэта ўсё, што вы ведаеце? Ці можаце сказаць мне яшчэ нешта пра востраў?" (Завяршыце).

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: ""There's a..." the boy says, rubbin..."
links.english: "There's a..." the boy says, rubbing his eyes. It's clear that he has no intention of finishing the sentence.
links.polish: „Tam jest...” – zaczyna chłopak, pocierając swoje oczy. Szybko staje się jasne, że nie zamierza dokończyć tego zdania.
links.belarusian: "Там ёсць..." — пачынае хлопец, паціраючы вочы. Хутка становіцца ясна, што ён не мае намеру скончыць гэтае сказ.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Lights? Fire guy?" The lieutenant..."
links.english: "Lights? Fire guy?" The lieutenant looks at you. "We should check up on that island and you..."
links.polish: „Światła? Ogniowy facet?” – porucznik spogląda na ciebie. „Musimy sprawdzić tę wyspę, a ty...”
links.belarusian: "Святло? Вогненны чалавек?" — лейтэнант глядзіць на цябе. "Мы павінны праверыць гэты востраў, а ты..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He whispers: "You need to keep your..."
links.english: He whispers: "You need to keep your *dark humour* in check in front of children, okay?"
links.polish: Kontynuuje szeptem: „Musisz panować nad tym swoim *czarnym humorem*, gdy rozmawiasz z dziećmi, jasne?”
links.belarusian: Працягвае шэптам: "Табе трэба кантраляваць свой *чорны гумар*, калі размаўляеш з дзецьмі, зразумела?"

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "I'm not telling you twice."
links.english: I'm not telling you twice.
links.polish: Nie będę ci tego dwa razy powtarzał.
links.belarusian: Я не буду табе гэтага два разы паўтараць.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Lights? Fire guy?" The lieutenant..."
links.english: "Lights? Fire guy?" The lieutenant looks at you. "We should check up on that island."
links.polish: „Światła? Ogniowy facet?” – porucznik spogląda na ciebie. „Musimy sprawdzić tę wyspę”.
links.belarusian: "Святло? Агністы чалавек?" – лейтэнант глядзіць на цябе. "Мы павінны праверыць гэты востраў".

links.title: You: ""Mhm." (Nod in agreement.)"
links.english: "Mhm." (Nod in agreement.)
links.polish: „Mhm”. (Kiwnij głową na znak zgody).
links.belarusian: "Мгм". (Ківайце галавой у знак згоды).

links.title: You: ""No, some other island. *Of course*..."
links.english: "No, some other island. *Of course* that one."
links.polish: „Nie, na jakiejś innej. *No pewnie*, że na tej”.
links.belarusian: "Не, на нейкай іншай. *Ну вядома*, што на гэтай".

links.title: Lilienne's Other Twin: ""Okay." His brother answers for him..."
links.english: "Okay." His brother answers for him.
links.polish: „W porządku” – odpowiada za niego brat.
links.belarusian: "У парадку" — адказвае за яго брат.

links.title: You: ""I need you to tell me what you kno..."
links.english: "I need you to tell me what you know about it -- what's *on* the island?"
links.polish: „Musicie powiedzieć mi, co wiecie o wyspie. Co na niej *jest*?”
links.belarusian: "Вы павінны сказаць мне, што вы ведаеце пра востраў. Што на ім *ёсць*?"

links.title: You: ""I heard you kids sometimes play in..."
links.english: "I heard you kids sometimes play in the abandoned Feld building?"
links.polish: „Słyszałem, że bawicie się czasami w opuszczonym budynku Felda?”
links.belarusian: "Я чуў, што вы часам гуляеце ў закінутым будынку Фельда?"

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: ""What's a Feld building?" one of th..."
links.english: "What's a Feld building?" one of the twins asks with a shrug.
links.polish: „Co to jest budynek Felda?” – pyta jeden z bliźniaków, wzruszając ramionami.
links.belarusian: "Што такое будынак Фельда?" – пытаецца адзін з двайнят, уздымаючы плячыма.

links.title: Lilienne's Other Twin: ""Nah, we don't go anywhere, nah," t..."
links.english: "Nah, we don't go anywhere, nah," the other mumbles.
links.polish: „Nie, my się stąd nie ruszamy” – mamrocze drugi.
links.belarusian: "Не, мы адсюль не сыдзем", — мармоча другі.

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: ""I dunno what you're talking about...."
links.english: "I dunno what you're talking about." The boy stuffs his hands deep into his pockets and kicks another rock.
links.polish: „Nie wiem, o czym pan mówi” – chłopak wsadza ręce głęboko w kieszenie i kopie kolejny kamień.
links.belarusian: "Я не ведаю, пра што вы кажаце", — хлопец засоўвае рукі глыбока ў кішэні і штурхае чарговы камень.

links.title: Lilienne's Other Twin: ""He dunno what you're talking about..."
links.english: "He dunno what you're talking about." The other nods.
links.polish: „On nie wie, o czym pan mówi” – potwierdza drugi, kiwając głową.
links.belarusian: "Ён не ведае, пра што вы гаворыце", — пацвярджае другі, ківаючы галавой.

links.title: You: ""Do *you* know what I'm talking abo..."
links.english: "Do *you* know what I'm talking about?"
links.polish: „A *ty* wiesz, o czym mówię?”
links.belarusian: "А *ты* ведаеш, пра што я гавару?"

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: ""He dunno what you're talking about..."
links.english: "He dunno what you're talking about," the first kid says loudly. Or you think it's the first kid -- it could be the second.
links.polish: „On nie wie, o czym pan mówi” – stwierdza głośno pierwszy chłopak. A przynajmniej masz wrażenie, że to pierwszy z nich – to równie dobrze może być drugi z braci.
links.belarusian: "Ён не ведае, пра што вы кажаце", — гучна заяўляе першы хлопец. Альбо, прынамсі, у вас склалася ўражанне, што гэта першы з іх — гэта таксама можа быць другі з братоў.

links.title: Lilienne's Other Twin: ""I dunno what you're talking about,..."
links.english: "I dunno what you're talking about," the other kid nods along.
links.polish: „Nie wiem, o czym pan mówi” – potwierdza drugi chłopak.
links.belarusian: "Не ведаю, пра што вы кажаце", — пацвярджае другі хлопец.

links.title: You: ""You're not helping me..""
links.english: "You're not helping me.."
links.polish: „Nie pomagacie...”
links.belarusian: "Вы не дапамагаеце..."

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: ""Ha ha, I dunno what you're talking..."
links.english: "Ha ha, I dunno what you're talking about." One of the boys shrugs his shoulders and starts laughing.
links.polish: „Ha, ha! Nie wiem, o czym pan mówi” – stwierdza jeden z chłopaków, wzrusza ramionami i zaczyna się śmiać.
links.belarusian: "Ха, ха! Я не ведаю, пра што вы гаворыце", — кажа адзін з хлопцаў, пацісківаючы плячыма і пачынаючы смяяцца.

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "It's a purposefully shrill laugh. L..."
links.english: It's a purposefully shrill laugh. Like he's practised it for the express purpose of annoying people.
links.polish: Śmiech jest zamierzenie piskliwy. Jak gdyby wyćwiczył go specjalnie po to, żeby irytować nim ludzi.
links.belarusian: Смех наўмысна пісклявы. Як быццам ён спецыяльна адпрацаваў яго, каб раздражняць людзей.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Are there actually two of them? Are..."
links.english: Are there actually two of them? Are you sure you're not just hallucinating or seeing double?
links.polish: Jest ich faktycznie dwóch? Na pewno nie masz halucynacji? Nie widzisz podwójnie?
links.belarusian: Іх сапраўды двое? Ты ўпэўнены, што не маеш галюцынацый? Не бачыш двайнае?

links.title: You: ""Bye." [Leave.]"
links.english: "Bye." [Leave.]
links.polish: „Pa”. [Odejdź].
links.belarusian: "Тата". [Адыдзі].

links.title: You: ""Bye." [Leave.]"
links.english: "Bye." [Leave.]
links.polish: „Pa”. [Odejdź].
links.belarusian: "Па". [Адыйдзі].

links.title: You: ""Kids, have you seen any bad people..."
links.english: "Kids, have you seen any bad people around?"
links.polish: „Hej, dzieciaki, widzieliście może w okolicy jakichś złych ludzi?”
links.belarusian: "Гэй, дзеткі, вы не бачылі, можа, паблізу нейкіх дрэнных людзей?"

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: ""What bad people?" One of the twins..."
links.english: "What bad people?" One of the twins looks up, his mouth slightly open.
links.polish: „Jakich złych ludzi?” – pyta jeden z bliźniaków, spoglądając w górę z lekko otwartymi ustami.
links.belarusian: "Якіх дрэнных людзей?" — пытаецца адзін з двайнят, злегка прыадкрыўшы вусны і зірнуўшы ўгору.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I don't think questioning four-yea..."
links.english: "I don't think questioning four-year-olds without their parents present is gonna crack the case," says the lieutenant.
links.polish: „Nie sądzę, aby przepytywanie czterolatków bez ich rodziców pomogło nam rozwiązać tę sprawę” – stwierdza porucznik.
links.belarusian: "Я не думаю, што апытанне чатырохгадовых дзяцей без іх бацькоў дапаможа нам вырашыць гэтую справу", — адзначае лейтэнант.

links.title: Authority: "Then we're *definitely* doing it."
links.english: Then we're *definitely* doing it.
links.polish: A więc *zdecydowanie* musimy to zrobić.
links.belarusian: Такім чынам, *канчаткова* мы павінны гэта зрабіць.

links.title: You: ""Bad people. Criminals. Dangerous w..."
links.english: "Bad people. Criminals. Dangerous women."
links.polish: „Po prostu złych ludzi. Przestępców. Niebezpieczne kobiety”.
links.belarusian: "Проста дрэнныя людзі. Злачынцы. Небяспечныя жанчыны".

links.title: Lilienne's Other Twin: ""No, we're not really supposed to t..."
links.english: "No, we're not really supposed to talk to strangers, you know." The other twin shakes his head.
links.polish: „Nie, nie powinniśmy rozmawiać z nieznajomymi” – stwierdza drugi bliźniak, kręcąc głową.
links.belarusian: "Не, не павінны мы размаўляць з незнаёмцамі", — зазначае другі блізнюк, трасучы галавой.

links.title: You: ""Hey, where is your mom?""
links.english: "Hey, where is your mom?"
links.polish: „Hej, gdzie jest wasza mama?”
links.belarusian: "Прывітанне, дзе ваша мама?"

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: "The kids don't reply, absorbed in t..."
links.english: The kids don't reply, absorbed in their little game.
links.polish: Chłopcy nie odpowiadają zaabsorbowani zabawą.
links.belarusian: Хлопцы не адказваюць, занятыя гуляннем.

links.title: You: ""You must be Lilienne's twins.""
links.english: "You must be Lilienne's twins."
links.polish: „Wy musicie być bliźniakami Lilienne”.
links.belarusian: "Вы, напэўна, Ліліенны блізняты".

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: ""Mhm. Lily's our mom," says one of..."
links.english: "Mhm. Lily's our mom," says one of the twins.
links.polish: „Mhm. Lily to nasza mama” – potwierdza jeden z bliźniaków.
links.belarusian: "Мгм. Лілі — гэта наша мама", — пацвярджае адзін з блізнят.

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: "This one doesn't say anything, kick..."
links.english: This one doesn't say anything, kicking the concrete with his worn-out sneaker.
links.polish: Ten bliźniak nie odzywa się, tylko kopie kawałek betonu swoimi znoszonymi trampkami.
links.belarusian: Гэты блізнюк не адклікаецца, толькі капаецца кавалкам бетону сваімі зношанымі кедамі.

links.title: Lilienne's Other Twin: ""Lily's our mom," explains the othe..."
links.english: "Lily's our mom," explains the other one, tongue still lolling out of his mouth.
links.polish: „Lily to nasza mama” – wyjaśnia drugi chłopak z wywieszonym językiem.
links.belarusian: "Лілі — гэта наша мама", — тлумачыць другі хлопчык з высунутым языком.

links.title: You: ""I already said that.""
links.english: "I already said that."
links.polish: „Już to powiedziałem”.
links.belarusian: "Я ўжо гэта сказаў".

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: "The stone-kicker laughs suddenly. H..."
links.english: The stone-kicker laughs suddenly. His head is too large for his shoulders.
links.polish: Kopiący kamień chłopak nagle wybucha śmiechem. Jego głowa jest za duża w porównaniu z jego ramionami.
links.belarusian: Хлопчык, які копае камень, раптам выбухаецца смехам. Яго галава занадта вялікая ў параўнанні з яго плячыма.

links.title: Lilienne's Other Twin: "The other one laughs as well."
links.english: The other one laughs as well.
links.polish: Drugi chłopak też się śmieje.
links.belarusian: Другі хлопец таксама смяецца.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Maybe there's some kind of reason w..."
links.english: Maybe there's some kind of reason why they're laughing? An interesting reason somehow tied to the case!
links.polish: Może jest jakiś powód, dla którego się śmieją? Jakaś ciekawa, powiązana ze sprawą przyczyna!
links.belarusian: Можа, ёсць нейкая прычына, чаму яны смяюцца? Нейкая цікавая, звязаная са справай прычына!

links.title: You: ""What are you laughing about?""
links.english: "What are you laughing about?"
links.polish: „Z czego się śmiejecie?”
links.belarusian: "З чаго вы смеяцеся?"

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: "The boy stops laughing and looks at..."
links.english: The boy stops laughing and looks at his toes.
links.polish: Chłopak przestaje się śmiać i wpatruje się w palce swoich stóp.
links.belarusian: Хлопец перастае смяяцца і ўтаропліваецца ў пальцы сваіх ног.

links.title: Half Light: "Oh, okay. So now he's *shy*. Now he..."
links.english: Oh, okay. So now he's *shy*. Now he's not talking, just wobbling around like he's afraid of something.
links.polish: Och, no dobrze. Teraz się *wstydzi*. Nic nie mówi, tylko się rozgląda, jakby coś go przestraszyło.
links.belarusian: Ах, ну добра. Цяпер ён *сороміцца*. Нічога не кажа, толькі аглядаецца, нібыта нешта яго напалохала.

links.title: Logic: "You will never get an answer. That'..."
links.english: You will never get an answer. That's how it is with these little idiots.
links.polish: Nigdy nie otrzymasz odpowiedzi. Tak to już jest z tymi małymi przygłupami.
links.belarusian: Ты ніколі не атрымаеш адказу. Так гэта ўжо з гэтымі маленькімі дурнямі.

links.title: You: "I don't care."
links.english: I don't care.
links.polish: Mam to gdzieś.
links.belarusian: Мне гэта абыякава.

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: "The boy keeps laughing. Then he bow..."
links.english: The boy keeps laughing. Then he bows down to inspect the rock as though there's something noteworthy about it.
links.polish: Chłopak śmieje się dalej. Po chwili schyla się, aby przyjrzeć się kamieniowi – jakby było w nim coś wartego uwagi.
links.belarusian: Хлопец працягвае смяяцца. Праз момант ён нахіляецца, каб прыгледзецца да каменя — нібы ў ім ёсць нешта вартае ўвагі.

links.title: Logic: "Wow, so intellectually stimulating."
links.english: Wow, so intellectually stimulating.
links.polish: Ojej, jakież to intelektualnie stymulujące.
links.belarusian: Ой, як гэта інтэлектуальна стымулююча.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "The stone-kicking isn't even of ver..."
links.english: The stone-kicking isn't even of very high calibre. Anyone can do that.
links.polish: To kopanie kamieni nie jest nawet jakieś wyjątkowo udane. Każdy by tak potrafił.
links.belarusian: Капанне камянёў не з'яўляецца чымсьці асабліва ўдалым. Кожны мог бы так зрабіць.

links.title: You: ""Bye." [Leave.]"
links.english: "Bye." [Leave.]
links.polish: „Pa”. [Odejdź].
links.belarusian: "Па". [Адыйдзі].

links.title: You: ""Is little Lily your sister?" (Poin..."
links.english: "Is little Lily your sister?" (Point to the house.)
links.polish: „Mała Lily to wasza siostra?” (Wskaż dom).
links.belarusian: "Маленькая Лілі — гэта ваша сястра?" (Пакажыце дом).

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: ""Yes.""
links.english: "Yes."
links.polish: „Tak”.
links.belarusian: "Так".

links.title: You: ""Yes?""
links.english: "Yes?"
links.polish: „Tak?”
links.belarusian: "Так?"

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: ""Yes.""
links.english: "Yes."
links.polish: „Tak”.
links.belarusian: "Так".

links.title: You: ""That's it? You're being laconic ab..."
links.english: "That's it? You're being laconic about it?"
links.polish: „I tyle? Tak lakonicznie?”
links.belarusian: "І ўсё? Так лаканічна?"

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: "It doesn't look like he knows what..."
links.english: It doesn't look like he knows what that means.
links.polish: Zdaje się, że nie rozumie, co do niego mówisz.
links.belarusian: Здаецца, ён не разумее, што ты яму кажаш.

links.title: You: ""Okay.""
links.english: "Okay."
links.polish: „Dobrze”.
links.belarusian: "Добра".

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: ""Yes.""
links.english: "Yes."
links.polish: „Tak”.
links.belarusian: "Так".

links.title: You: ""You guys look identical.""
links.english: "You guys look identical."
links.polish: „Wyglądacie identycznie, chłopaki”.
links.belarusian: "Вы выглядаеце аднолькава, хлопцы".

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: "One of the boys nods, the other one..."
links.english: One of the boys nods, the other one looks at his brother and shrugs.
links.polish: Jeden z chłopców kiwa głową, a drugi spogląda na swojego brata i wzrusza ramionami.
links.belarusian: Адзін з хлопчыкаў ківае галавой, а другі глядзіць на свайго брата і паціскае плячыма.

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: "The stone-kicking one becomes frant..."
links.english: The stone-kicking one becomes frantic all of a sudden, as if that's something to be scared of -- the obvious fact that you just stated.
links.polish: Ten kopiący kamień nagle zaczyna zachowywać się dziwnie, zupełnie jakby czegoś się bał – najwyraźniej tym czymś jest oczywisty fakt, który właśnie stwierdziłeś.
links.belarusian: Гэты, хто капае камень, раптам пачынае паводзіць сябе дзіўна, зусім як быццам бы нечага баяўся — відавочна, што гэтай прычынай ёсць відавочны факт, які ты толькі што адзначыў.

links.title: Lilienne's Other Twin: ""He looks just like me," the other..."
links.english: "He looks just like me," the other one says.
links.polish: „To on wygląda jak ja” – odzywa się drugi chłopak.
links.belarusian: "Гэта ён выглядае як я" — кажа другі хлопец.

links.title: You: ""Yeah, I said that.""
links.english: "Yeah, I said that."
links.polish: „Tak, właśnie to powiedziałem”.
links.belarusian: "Так, менавіта гэта я сказаў".

links.title: Lilienne's Other Twin: "The boy doesn't answer. His brother..."
links.english: The boy doesn't answer. His brother throws another rock. Both of their hair is covered in some kind of dirt.
links.polish: Chłopak nie odpowiada. Jego brat ciska kolejnym kamieniem. Włosy obu są pokryte jakimś brudem.
links.belarusian: Хлопец не адказвае. Яго брат кідае яшчэ адзін камень. Воласы абодвух пакрытыя нейкай брудам.

links.title: Composure: "The rock-kicker was just being *shy..."
links.english: The rock-kicker was just being *shy*, but now he's enthusiastic again.
links.polish: Ten od kopania kamieni się po prostu *wstydził*. Teraz wrócił mu entuzjazm.
links.belarusian: Ён проста *саромеўся* капаць камяні. Цяпер у яго вярнуўся энтузіязм.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You're bad with kids," the lieuten..."
links.english: "You're bad with kids," the lieutenant remarks with evident glee.
links.polish: „Nie radzisz sobie z dziećmi” – zauważa porucznik z wyraźną radością.
links.belarusian: "Не спраўляешся з дзецьмі", — заўважае лейтэнант з яўнай радасцю.

links.title: You: ""I am, yes.""
links.english: "I am, yes."
links.polish: „Tak, nie radzę sobie”.
links.belarusian: "Так, я не даю сабе рады".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Don't worry, everyone is." He look..."
links.english: "Don't worry, everyone is." He looks at the little scruffian, then at you. "How about we do some police work now? We're not getting anything here."
links.polish: „Nie przejmuj się, wszyscy tak mają” – pociesza cię. Spogląda na małych rozczochrańców, a później na ciebie. „Może zajmiemy się teraz policyjną robotą? Tracimy tu tylko czas”.
links.belarusian: "Не хвалюйся, усе так маюць" — суцяшае цябе. Глядзіць на маленькіх растрэп і потым на цябе. "Можа, возьмемся цяпер за паліцэйскую працу? Толькі марнуем тут час".

links.title: You: ""And what are you, Kid Master Gener..."
links.english: "And what are you, Kid Master General?"
links.polish: „A ty co, jesteś niby wielkim dziecięcym generałem?”
links.belarusian: "А ты што, нібыта вялікі дзіцячы генерал?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Maybe I am?" He grins. "Now, how a..."
links.english: "Maybe I am?" He grins. "Now, how about some actual police work? We're not getting anything here."
links.polish: „Może jestem?” – stwierdza, szczerząc zęby. „Może zajmiemy się teraz policyjną robotą? Tracimy tu tylko czas”.
links.belarusian: "Можа, я?" — заяўляе, усміхаючыся. "Можа, цяпер зоймемся паліцэйскай работай? Мы тут толькі марнуем час".

links.title: You: ""It's impossible to be *good* with..."
links.english: "It's impossible to be *good* with kids, they're too stupid."
links.polish: „Nie da się *radzić* sobie z dziećmi, są zbyt głupie”.
links.belarusian: "Нельга *спраўляцца* з дзецьмі, яны занадта дурныя".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You're right there." He looks at t..."
links.english: "You're right there." He looks at the little scruffian, then at you. "Let's see if we can find some police work, shall we? We're not getting anything here."
links.polish: „Masz rację” – stwierdza. Spogląda na małych rozczochrańców, a później na ciebie. „Może zajmiemy się teraz policyjną robotą? Tracimy tu tylko czas”.
links.belarusian: "Ты маеш рацыю", — адзначае ён. Ён глядзіць на маленькіх растрапаных, а потым на цябе. "Можа быць, зоймемся цяпер паліцэйскай справай? Мы тут толькі марнуем час".

links.title: You: ""Bye." [Leave.]"
links.english: "Bye." [Leave.]
links.polish: „Pa”. [Odejdź].
links.belarusian: "Па". [Адыйдзі].

links.title: You: ""Children are stupid.""
links.english: "Children are stupid."
links.polish: „Dzieci są głupie”.
links.belarusian: "Дзеці дурныя".

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: ""Maybe *you're* stupid!""
links.english: "Maybe *you're* stupid!"
links.polish: „Może *pan* jest głupi!”
links.belarusian: "Можа *пан* дурань!"

links.title: Lilienne's Other Twin: ""Don't say that, he's a *po-leees o..."
links.english: "Don't say that, he's a *po-leees oooffi-ser*," his brother whispers.
links.polish: „Nie mów tak, on jest *po-liiii-cjaaaan-tem*” – szepcze jego brat.
links.belarusian: "Не кажы так, ён ёсць *мілі-цыаааа-нерам*" – шэпча яго брат.

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: ""Ha-ha," the scruffy-haired little..."
links.english: "Ha-ha," the scruffy-haired little kid laughs, as though in agreement.
links.polish: „Ha, ha!” – śmieje się rozczochrany chłopak, jakby się z tobą zgadzał.
links.belarusian: "Ха, ха!" — смяецца растрапаны хлопец, як быццам згодны з табой.

links.title: Lilienne's Other Twin: ""You're stupid," the other one tell..."
links.english: "You're stupid," the other one tells him, suddenly very serious.
links.polish: „Ty jesteś głupi” – oznajmia mu drugi chłopak bardzo poważnym tonem.
links.belarusian: "Ты дурань", — абвясціў яму другі хлопец вельмі сур'ёзным тонам.

links.title: You: ""Okay, how about the policeman asks..."
links.english: "Okay, how about the policeman asks you something else now?"
links.polish: „No dobra, to może policjant spyta was teraz o coś innego?”
links.belarusian: "Ну добра, можа, міліцыянер цяпер спытае вас пра нешта іншае?"

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: ""Okay." The scruffy-haired boy squi..."
links.english: "Okay." The scruffy-haired boy squints up at you.
links.polish: „Dobra” – stwierdza rozczochrany chłopak, przyglądając ci się z przymrużonymi oczami.
links.belarusian: "Добра", — заявіў растрапаны хлопец, уважліва ўглядаючыся ў цябе прыжмуранымі вачыма.

links.title: You: ""I'm just gonna leave now. I'm gonn..."
links.english: "I'm just gonna leave now. I'm gonna leave and not talk to you anymore." [Leave.]
links.polish: „Po prostu sobie pójdę. Pójdę i nie będę z wami więcej rozmawiał”. [Odejdź].
links.belarusian: "Проста пайду. Пайду і больш не буду з вамі размаўляць". [Сыходзь].

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: "Just a second ago, the first one wa..."
links.english: Just a second ago, the first one was laughing. Now he's doing something with his lip and his gap tooth.
links.polish: Jeszcze sekundę wcześniej pierwszy chłopak się śmiał. Teraz robi coś dziwnego ze swoją wargą i szczerbą między zębami.
links.belarusian: Яшчэ секунду таму першы хлопец смяяўся. Зараз ён робіць нешта дзіўнае са сваёй губой і шчылінай паміж зубамі.

links.title: Empathy: "It looks like he's *sad*. Because y..."
links.english: It looks like he's *sad*. Because you're going or... who knows, really?
links.polish: Wygląda to, jakby był *smutny*. Bo sobie idziesz albo... Właściwie to kto wie?
links.belarusian: Гэта выглядае, як быццам ён *сумны*. Бо вы сыходзіце або... Вось хто ведае?

links.title: Logic: "There's no *system* to this."
links.english: There's no *system* to this.
links.polish: Ich zachowanie nie rządzi się żadnymi *prawami*.
links.belarusian: Іх паводзіны не падпарадкоўваюцца ніякім *законам*.

links.title: You: ""You're being *random*!""
links.english: "You're being *random*!"
links.polish: „Wykazujecie kompletną *przypadkowość*!”
links.belarusian: "Праяўляеце поўную *выпадковасць*!"

links.title: Lilienne's Twin: ""You're stupid," the other one repe..."
links.english: "You're stupid," the other one repeats, still deathly serious.
links.polish: „Ty jesteś głupi” – powtarza drugi chłopak wciąż śmiertelnie poważnym tonem.
links.belarusian: "Ты дурны" — паўтарае другі хлопчык усё яшчэ смяротна сур'ёзным тонам.

links.title: Rhetoric: "The secrets of understanding the to..."
links.english: The secrets of understanding the tongues of children have been lost to you a long time ago.
links.polish: Tajemnice mowy dzieci uleciały z twojego umysłu już bardzo dawno temu.
links.belarusian: Таямніцы мовы дзяцей ужо вельмі даўно зніклі з твайго розуму.

links.title: You: ""Bye." [Leave.]"
links.english: "Bye." [Leave.]
links.polish: „Pa”. [Odejdź].
links.belarusian: "Па". [Адыйдзі].

links.title: You: ""Bye." [Leave.]"
links.english: "Bye." [Leave.]
links.polish: „Pa”. [Odejdź].
links.belarusian: "Па". [Адыдзі].

links.title: You: ""Bye kids, take care." [Leave.]"
links.english: "Bye kids, take care." [Leave.]
links.polish: „Pa, dzieciaki. Trzymajcie się”. [Odejdź].
links.belarusian: "Пакуль, дзеці. Трымайцеся". [Сыходзь].

dialogueTree.title: Lilienne's Twin: "The scruffy-haired little boy kicks..."
dialogueTree.english: The scruffy-haired little boy kicks a stone. He can't be more than five years old.
dialogueTree.polish: Rozczochrany chłopiec kopie kamień. Nie może mieć więcej niż pięć lat.
dialogueTree.belarusian: Кудлаты хлопчык пнуў камень. Яму не можа быць больш за пяць гадоў.

links.title: Lilienne's Other Twin: "The other one looks indistinguishab..."
links.english: The other one looks indistinguishable from him. He watches his brother kick the stone with his tongue lolling out of his mouth.
links.polish: Drugi wygląda dokładnie tak samo jak on. Z językiem na wierzchu przygląda się bratu kopiącemu kamień.
links.belarusian: Другі выглядае дакладна гэтак жа, як ён. З высунутым языком ён назірае, як брат капае камень.
